data.title: Is Grant Mitchell returning to EastEnders as Sharon Watts calls him about Phil?
data.meta_description: SPOILER ALERT: Avert your eyes if you don't want to read about any potential upcoming 'doof doofs'. Could we be witnessing a much-anticipated return of Ros
data.text:
Virgin Radio

6 Jul 2022, 16:05

SPOILER ALERT: Avert your eyes if you don't want to read about any potential upcoming 'doof doofs'. Could we be witnessing a much-anticipated return of Ross Kemp aka the infamous Grant Mitchell to Albert Square?

Sofa detectives have gone into overdrive after watching Sharon Watts (Letitia Dean) try and get in contact with her ex-husband to tell him about Philâ€™s (Steve McFadden) impending doom after fellow inmate Craig Erskine (Connor Mills) threatened to kill him.

Backup prisoner ally Ravi Gulati (Aaron Thiara) was due to help him against Connor, but was transferred to solitary so is out of action for the 6pm literal deadline.

Although DI Keeble (Alison Newman) offered to get Phil out of jail in exchange for underground information, Phil has refused to play the card and be a 'grass', much to Sharon's dismay.

After confessing her undying love for Phil and being dragged off by prison guards, Sharon was seen calling her ex spouse to tell him the devastating predicament. But Grant didn't pick up.

So what will happen to Phil and has Sharon given away a vital clue to Grant's ever-anticipated comeback?

The last time he was back was for mum (Barbara Windsor) Peggy's death in 2016 and later that year when he briefly joined forces with Phil.

Grant is currently living in Portugal with his daughter, Courtney. Let's hope and pray for Phil - and his brother's return to E20.
